brent.intro: Brent Crude is the benchmark oil for Atlantic basin trading, originally from the Brent field in the North Sea between Shetland and Norway. Modern Brent pricing references a basket of five North Sea fields (BFOET). A light, sweet crude with API gravity around 38 and low sulphur content.
brent.materials: Black viscous crude with rainbow iridescent surface sheen, rusted and painted steel platform structure, heavy chain and cable rigging, salt-crusted metal surfaces, rubber pipeline joints, flame from gas flare stack, white sea spray, dark crude-stained concrete.

origin.subject: Steel offshore oil production platform rising from a grey churning sea, multiple deck levels with derrick tower above, gas flare burning orange at the boom tip
origin.lens: 24mm f/8, wide dramatic perspective capturing full platform structure from waterline to flare tip, deep depth showing sea context
origin.enhancer: Rusted salt-weathered steel structure, orange flame against grey overcast sky, white sea spray crashing against platform legs, small supply vessel alongside, industrial scale dwarfing the ocean

environments._default: Open sea with grey-green waves, steel jacket platform with multiple processing decks, helicopter pad on top deck, supply vessel approaching, overcast North Sea sky
environments.NO: Norwegian Continental Shelf, massive concrete gravity-base platform in deep water, snow-dusted upper decks in winter, fjord supply base visible on distant coastline
environments.GB: UK North Sea sector east of Shetland, steel jacket platform in moderate sea state, accommodation module connected by bridge, flare boom extending leeward
environments.SA: Saudi Arabian offshore platform in the Persian Gulf, flat calm turquoise water, multiple satellite platforms connected by causeways, extreme heat haze, desert coastline beyond
environments.BR: Brazilian pre-salt FPSO off the Santos Basin coast, massive converted tanker hull moored in deep water, offloading shuttle tanker alongside, Atlantic swell

extraction.subject: Drilling floor on an oil rig, roughneck crew manoeuvring pipe into the rotary table, iron roughneck tong gripping the drill string, mud flowing in the return line
extraction.lens: 35mm f/4, documentary industrial depth, capturing both physical labour and heavy machinery together, environmental portrait of the drill floor
extraction.enhancer: Oil-smeared overalls and hard hats, heavy steel pipe sections, chain tongs and slips, drilling mud splatter on deck plates, fluorescent deck lights against exterior darkness or daylight

environments._default: Drill floor of an offshore jack-up rig, open to the elements on two sides with the sea visible, steel grating underfoot, pipe rack stacked with joints, drawworks behind
environments.NO: Norwegian semi-submersible drill floor, enclosed against Arctic weather, advanced top-drive system, winter darkness or midnight sun outside the weatherproofed walls
environments.SA: Saudi Aramco onshore rig in the Ghawar field, open desert surroundings, sand drifts against the substructure, extreme brightness outside the rig floor shade
environments.US: Permian Basin land rig in West Texas, triple derrick rising from flat scrubland, pump jacks nodding on adjacent pads, pickup trucks parked nearby

processing.subject: Towering fractional distillation columns at an oil refinery, complex pipe networks connecting multiple towers, steam venting from pressure relief valves
processing.lens: 24mm f/11 looking upward, converging vertical lines emphasising industrial height, full depth from ground-level pipes to column tops against the sky
processing.enhancer: Chrome and steel pipe surfaces reflecting surrounding structures, steam and vapour wisps from joints, red warning lights on column tops, complex valve assemblies and flanged connections

environments._default: Major oil refinery with multiple distillation units, catalytic cracker in the background, tank farm beyond, flare stack burning excess gas
environments.US: Houston Ship Channel refinery complex, enormous sprawling facility, cooling towers releasing steam clouds, Texas highway overpass framing the view
environments.GB: Grangemouth refinery on the Firth of Forth, grey Scottish sky, compact site between river and hills, Kincardine Bridge visible beyond
environments.NL: Rotterdam Europoort refinery, waterway frontage with barges moored alongside, flat Dutch landscape, wind turbines visible beyond the tank farm
environments.SA: Ras Tanura refinery on the Gulf coast, massive facility gleaming in harsh sunlight, crude tankers at the marine terminal, desert beyond the fence line

finished.subject: Massive oil tanker loaded low in the water, dark hull stretching the length of the frame, deck pipelines and manifolds running fore to aft, bow wave cutting through the sea
finished.lens: 35mm f/8, three-quarter bow view from slightly above waterline, showing both ship scale and loaded draught line, sea filling the foreground
finished.enhancer: Plimsoll line submerged confirming full cargo, rust streaks on dark hull paint, white superstructure at stern contrasting dark forward deck, wake pattern trailing behind, seabirds following

environments._default: Open shipping lane, deep blue-grey sea, tanker in transit, distant coastline or another vessel on the horizon
environments.GB: English Channel off Dover, white cliffs visible in background, busy shipping lane with multiple vessels, pilot cutter approaching
environments.NO: Norwegian fjord approach to Mongstad terminal, steep green mountainsides rising from the waterline, small pilot boat alongside the tanker hull
environments.SG: Singapore Strait, ultra-large tanker threading between anchored vessels, city skyline and container cranes visible on both sides of the passage
environments.SA: VLCC departing Ras Tanura terminal, Persian Gulf flat calm, desert shoreline and loading gantries receding behind, extreme heat haze above the water

crude_oil.intro: West Texas Intermediate is the primary US oil benchmark, a light sweet crude with API gravity around 39.6 and very low sulphur. Priced at Cushing, Oklahoma — the pipeline crossroads of America where dozens of pipelines converge at a massive tank farm. WTI is delivered by pipeline from the Permian Basin, Eagle Ford, and Bakken formations.
crude_oil.materials: Dark amber-to-black crude with slight translucency in thin film, chrome pipeline valves and flanges, white-painted steel storage tank walls, rusted ladder rungs, dried red Oklahoma clay, sun-bleached pump jack steel, rubber wellhead seals.

origin.subject: Pump jack nodding slowly in an oil field, polished steel horse-head rising and falling against the sky, sucker rod pulling crude from below ground
origin.lens: 35mm f/8, classic American industrial landscape, pump jack silhouetted or side-lit with surrounding terrain visible, one-third sky
origin.enhancer: Rhythmic mechanical motion frozen mid-stroke, polished counterweight gleaming, black oil staining the ground around the wellhead, mesquite scrub and fence posts nearby

environments._default: Flat semi-arid oil field with scattered pump jacks nodding across the terrain, gravel access roads between well pads, pipeline markers, distant tank battery
environments.US: Permian Basin in West Texas, red-brown desert soil, dozens of pump jacks visible across flat mesquite country, flare stacks burning associated gas on the horizon
environments.CA: Alberta oil sands region, boreal forest cleared for well pads, winter snow on the ground, steam rising from SAGD well pairs, frost on equipment
environments.RU: Western Siberian marshland, insulated pipeline running through birch forest, wellhead Christmas tree valve stack, frozen puddles on gravel pad, grey overcast sky

extraction.subject: Wellhead Christmas tree valve assembly at the surface, maze of hand-wheels and pressure gauges, crude oil flowing through the production manifold into a gathering line
extraction.lens: 50mm f/4, clean industrial close-up, sharp detail on valve assemblies and pipe connections, enough depth to show the surrounding well pad
extraction.enhancer: Polished steel valve handles, brass pressure gauge faces with needle readings, crude oil staining around pipe joints, frost or heat shimmer on metal surfaces depending on climate

environments._default: Concrete well pad with Christmas tree assembly, flow lines running to a separator unit, tank battery visible nearby, gravel access road
environments.US: Eagle Ford shale pad in South Texas, multiple wellheads on a single pad from horizontal drilling, green mesquite brush surrounding the fenced perimeter
environments.SA: Ghawar field wellhead in the Arabian desert, immaculately maintained equipment, sand drifts against the pad wall, pipeline right-of-way disappearing into heat haze
environments.RU: Siberian well pad in winter, insulated pipelines on raised supports, snow drifts banked against equipment housings, steam from heated separators

processing.subject: Cushing Oklahoma tank farm seen from above, dozens of white cylindrical floating-roof storage tanks arranged in neat rows, pipeline manifolds connecting them, surrounded by earthen containment berms
processing.lens: 24mm f/11 from elevated position or drone perspective, showing the enormous scale of the tank farm, geometric pattern of circles and lines, flat Oklahoma prairie beyond
processing.enhancer: White tank roofs with floating pontoons visible, dark crude oil staining around fill points, earthen containment dikes between tank rows, pipeline junction manifold with multiple valve stations

environments._default: Major crude oil storage terminal with rows of large white tanks, pipeline interconnections, loading gantry for rail or truck, flat agricultural land surrounding
environments.US: Cushing Oklahoma hub, world's largest crude storage complex, grid of tanks stretching for kilometres, railroad siding with tank cars, wheat fields abutting the terminal fence

finished.subject: Black crude oil pouring in a thick viscous stream from a pipe into a sample container, showing the liquid's true colour and consistency, rainbow iridescence on the surface film
finished.lens: 85mm macro f/3.5, extreme close-up on the pouring stream, shallow depth isolating the liquid against a blurred industrial background
finished.enhancer: Thick viscous stream with visible flow lines, rainbow iridescent surface film, dark amber translucency where the stream is thinnest, oil droplets on the container rim, laboratory glassware nearby

environments._default: Pipeline terminal or refinery quality control lab, stainless steel sampling point, laboratory glassware and testing equipment, clipboard with specification sheets
environments.US: Cushing terminal quality lab, API gravity test equipment, multiple sample jars of different crude grades lined up for comparison, pipeline schematic on the wall

gasoline.intro: Gasoline (petrol in the UK/EU) is the primary refined product from crude oil, produced by catalytic cracking and reforming in refineries. The RBOB (Reformulated Blendstock for Oxygenate Blending) contract is the US benchmark. Gasoline is a clear to pale yellow liquid with a distinctive volatile smell, distributed by pipeline, barge, and tanker truck to retail stations.
gasoline.materials: Clear pale-yellow liquid with high volatility shimmer, chrome and steel fuel nozzle, rubber fuel hose, painted steel tanker body with hazmat placards, concrete forecourt surface, illuminated price sign, glass fuel dispenser sight tube.

origin.subject: Catalytic cracking unit at a refinery, riser reactor tower with regenerator vessel beside it, network of transfer lines between them, catalyst dust visible in vents
origin.lens: 24mm f/8, industrial scale shot looking up at the cracking unit, pipes and vessels filling the frame, steam and catalyst haze creating atmosphere
origin.enhancer: Massive cylindrical reactor vessels connected by diagonal transfer lines, insulated pipes with aluminium cladding, catalyst fines dusting horizontal surfaces, red aviation warning lights on top

environments._default: Major oil refinery FCC unit, surrounded by pipe racks and supporting infrastructure, cooling towers behind, flare stack on the perimeter
environments.US: Gulf Coast refinery in Texas or Louisiana, enormous FCC unit towering above the bayou landscape, humidity haze softening distant structures, security fencing
environments.NL: Rotterdam Europoort, European-scale FCC unit with barge loading terminal adjacent, flat polder landscape, North Sea wind turbines beyond
environments.IN: Jamnagar refinery complex in Gujarat, world's largest refinery, multiple FCC units in a massive integrated facility, Arabian Sea coastline visible

extraction.subject: Clear pale-yellow gasoline flowing through a sight glass on a refinery blending header, product pipeline rack behind with labelled lines for different fuel grades
extraction.lens: 50mm f/4, clean industrial product shot, sharp focus on the sight glass showing fuel flow and colour, pipeline rack providing context
extraction.enhancer: Crystal-clear yellow-tinted liquid visible through glass, flow indicators and temperature gauges on adjacent pipes, grade labels stencilled on pipeline supports, stainless steel fittings

environments._default: Refinery product blending area, multiple pipeline headers running in parallel, quality control sampling station nearby, tank farm in the background
environments.US: Houston refinery blending terminal, massive pipeline rack carrying multiple fuel grades to the Colonial Pipeline for East Coast distribution
environments.GB: Fawley refinery near Southampton, product pipelines running to distribution terminal, grey English sky, hedgerows beyond the perimeter

processing.subject: Fuel tanker truck being loaded at a refinery distribution rack, bottom-loading arms connected to the tanker's belly valves, vapour recovery hood above, driver checking the metering panel
processing.lens: 35mm f/5.6, documentary perspective showing the full loading process — truck, loading arms, and rack structure — with enough context to show the terminal behind
processing.enhancer: Polished aluminium tanker body reflecting surroundings, black rubber loading hoses, hazmat diamond placards on tank compartments, digital flow meter display, yellow safety bollards

heating_oil.intro: Heating oil (No. 2 fuel oil) is a middle distillate refined from crude oil, nearly identical to diesel fuel but dyed red for tax identification. It is the primary home heating fuel in the northeastern United States and parts of Europe. Delivered by tanker truck to residential and commercial storage tanks, consumed in oil-fired boilers and furnaces during winter months.
heating_oil.materials: Clear red-dyed liquid with slight oily sheen, green or red painted steel storage tank with fill pipe, copper fuel lines, cast iron boiler sections, brass fittings and valves, concrete basement floor, rubber delivery hose with brass coupling.

origin.subject: Red-dyed heating oil visible through a clear sample jar held up against daylight, deep ruby-red colour clearly distinct from clear diesel, laboratory bench behind
origin.lens: 85mm f/3.5, product beauty shot, shallow depth isolating the sample jar, light passing through the liquid showing true colour
origin.enhancer: Deep ruby-red translucent liquid in a cylindrical glass jar, daylight transmission showing colour density, oily meniscus at the glass edge, test spec sheet and hydrometer nearby

environments._default: Refinery quality control laboratory, stainless steel bench, multiple fuel sample jars in a rack showing different distillate grades, testing equipment
environments.US: Northeast US fuel distributor testing lab, winter weather visible through the window, delivery schedule board on the wall, red-dyed samples in labeled jars
environments.DE: German heating oil depot in Bavaria or Rhineland, double-walled Heizöl tank trucks delivering to residential customers, half-timbered houses with oil tanks in the cellar, German energy transition slowly replacing oil heating but millions of homes still dependent
environments.JP: Japanese kerosene (touyu) delivery truck in a residential neighbourhood, portable kerosene heaters ubiquitous in Japanese homes, kerosene pump at the local gas station, cold Tohoku or Hokkaido winter, the distinctive blue kerosene containers

extraction.subject: Heating oil delivery truck parked outside a New England house, driver unreeling the delivery hose from the truck reel, connecting brass coupling to the house fill pipe

ethanol.intro: Fuel ethanol is a biofuel produced by fermenting and distilling plant sugars — primarily corn in the United States and sugarcane in Brazil. The US produces roughly 60% of global ethanol, blended into gasoline at E10 (10%) or E85 (85%) concentrations. Brazilian ethanol from sugarcane is more energy-efficient to produce and can run vehicles as neat fuel (E100). Ethanol is a clear, colourless liquid with a faint sweet smell.
ethanol.materials: Clear colourless liquid indistinguishable from water by sight, golden dried corn kernels, green sugarcane stalks with purple-streaked skin, copper distillation column plates, stainless steel fermentation vessel walls, pale spent grain (distillers grains), white steam from distillation columns.

origin.subject: Tall green corn crop at full height in midsummer, tassels and silk emerging from the ears, dense rows stretching to the vanishing point across flat agricultural land
origin.lens: 24mm f/8, epic American agricultural landscape, low camera position looking along the row canyon, corn towering overhead, vast sky above
origin.enhancer: Dark green leaves arching overhead forming a canopy, pale tassels catching sunlight, fine silk threads emerging from ear husks, rich dark soil between rows, humidity haze in the air

environments._default: Flat agricultural plain, dense green corn at 2-metre height, section-line roads forming grid on the horizon, grain elevator visible in the distance
environments.US: Iowa corn belt, dead-flat black prairie soil, corn stretching unbroken to the horizon in every direction, farmstead with white barn and silos visible two miles away
environments.BR: São Paulo state sugarcane field, tall dense cane stalks with purple-green skin reaching 3 metres, red laterite soil between rows, distant sugar mill chimney smoking
environments.IN: Uttar Pradesh sugarcane field, dense cane thicket on alluvial Gangetic plain, narrow irrigation channels between plots, bullocks resting under a mango tree at field edge
environments.CN: Chinese corn field in Jilin or Heilongjiang province, Manchurian black soil producing corn for the fuel ethanol programme, flat fertile plains stretching to the horizon, cold continental climate, state-mandated E10 blending in northern provinces
environments.TH: Thai sugarcane and cassava fields in Nakhon Ratchasima or Khon Kaen, feedstock for Thailand's E20/E85 ethanol programme, tropical Isan plateau, small-holder farmers supplying ethanol refineries

extraction.enhancer: Golden dried corn stalks being consumed by the header, grain streaming from the unloading auger in an arc, chaff dust cloud glowing in backlight, tractor and grain cart keeping pace alongside

environments.TH: Thai ethanol distillery processing cassava and molasses, tropical industrial setting, government B100/E20 blending mandates, one of Southeast Asia's largest ethanol producers

environments.BR: Brazilian posto de gasolina, all pumps offering both gasolina and álcool (ethanol), motorcycles and flex-fuel cars, tropical street scene, Petrobras or Shell branding
environments.CN: Chinese petrol station with E10 labelling in Heilongjiang, driver refuelling, Chinese government biofuel policy in action, Mandarin signage, northern Chinese city

propane.intro: Propane (C₃H₈) is a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) extracted from natural gas processing and oil refining. Stored as a liquid under modest pressure (about 12 bar at 20°C), it vaporises when released and burns with a clean blue flame. Used for home heating, cooking, barbecues, agricultural crop drying, forklift fuel, and as petrochemical feedstock. Mont Belvieu, Texas is the US pricing hub.
propane.materials: Invisible gas when released but visible as white vapour cloud in cold air, pale blue combustion flame, painted steel cylinder with stamped test dates, brass regulator with pressure gauge, rubber hose with crimp fittings, corrugated steel bullet tank, frost forming on tank surface during rapid draw-off.

origin.subject: Natural gas processing plant with multiple fractionation towers separating propane from the gas stream, pipe racks connecting towers, refrigeration units with frost on the exterior
origin.lens: 24mm f/8, wide industrial landscape showing the full fractionation train from inlet to product storage, multiple towers in sequence
origin.enhancer: Frost and ice buildup on cryogenic pipe sections, insulated vessels with aluminium cladding, pressure relief valves venting small plumes, complex pipe manifolds at tower bases, security lighting

environments._default: Gas processing facility in semi-arid terrain, multiple fractionation columns in a row, product storage spheres and bullets behind, gas flare on the perimeter
environments.US: Mont Belvieu NGL hub in Texas, massive fractionation complex, underground salt cavern storage, pipeline junction with multiple inbound lines from the Permian and Eagle Ford
environments.SA: Saudi Aramco Yanbu NGL plant, enormous scale on the Red Sea coast, LPG export jetty visible, desert surroundings, extreme clarity in dry air
environments.AU: North West Shelf LNG/LPG plant in Karratha, gas processing trains facing the Indian Ocean, red Pilbara earth, gas flare against deep blue tropical sky

natural_gas.intro: Natural gas is primarily methane (CH₄) extracted from underground reservoirs, often co-located with oil deposits or in dedicated gas fields. The Henry Hub in Louisiana is the US benchmark pricing point where 13 interstate pipelines interconnect. Gas is transported by pipeline as a gas, or liquefied at -162°C for export by LNG tanker. Used for electricity generation, industrial heating, residential cooking and heating, and as chemical feedstock.
natural_gas.materials: Invisible odourless gas (mercaptan odorant added for safety detection), blue combustion flame on a gas burner, chrome and steel pipeline valves, yellow polyethylene distribution pipes, grey steel transmission pipeline, white insulated LNG storage tank, frost and fog around cryogenic equipment.

origin.subject: Natural gas wellhead in a shale field, steel Christmas tree valve stack with multiple gauges and choke valves, condensate separator nearby, flare stack burning associated gas
origin.lens: 35mm f/5.6, industrial landscape showing the well pad and surrounding terrain, wellhead equipment in the foreground third with the field stretching behind
origin.enhancer: Polished steel handwheels and pressure gauges on the wellhead, frost on choke valve body from Joule-Thomson cooling, orange flare flame against the sky, gravel pad surface

environments._default: Semi-arid gas field, multiple well pads visible across rolling terrain, gathering pipeline network on the surface, compressor station humming in the middle distance
environments.US: Marcellus Shale in Pennsylvania, well pad carved from Appalachian forest, green deciduous trees surrounding the cleared pad, multiple wellheads from horizontal drilling
environments.QA: North Field offshore platform in the Persian Gulf, massive gas-processing topsides, flat calm turquoise sea, Qatar coastline and LNG terminal visible in the distance

ttf_gas.intro: Title Transfer Facility (TTF) is the European natural gas benchmark, operated by Gasunie Transport Services in the Netherlands. Originally tied to the Groningen gas field (the largest in Europe, now being shut down), TTF has become the dominant price reference for European pipeline gas and LNG imports. Priced in EUR/MWh, it reflects the balance of Norwegian pipeline supply, LNG imports, and storage levels across Europe.
ttf_gas.materials: Same physical material as natural gas — invisible methane. Infrastructure differs: yellow high-pressure steel pipelines, green-painted valve stations, white cylindrical gas storage holders, underground salt cavern wellheads, grey control room panels with SCADA screens.

origin.subject: Groningen gas field wellhead cluster in the flat Dutch countryside, multiple Christmas tree valve assemblies behind a security fence, subsidence marker posts in the surrounding field
origin.lens: 35mm f/8, Dutch landscape perspective, flat horizon with enormous sky, wellhead cluster occupying the lower third, polder landscape stretching behind
origin.enhancer: Steel valve assemblies against dramatic Dutch sky, subsidence monitoring posts in neat rows, drainage canal alongside the access road, wet green pasture, distant church steeple on the horizon line

environments._default: Flat northern European landscape, gas wellhead cluster behind security fencing, agricultural land surrounding, high-voltage power lines crossing the background
environments.NL: Groningen province, perfectly flat polder with drainage canals, wellhead cluster beside a narrow road, grazing cattle in the adjacent field, distant red-brick farmhouse, windmill visible
environments.NO: Norwegian pipeline landfall at Easington or Emden, massive yellow pipeline emerging from the seabed, valve station compound, grey North Sea in the background
environments.BE: Zeebrugge LNG terminal on the Belgian coast, LNG carriers arriving from Qatar and the US, regasification sending gas into the European grid, North Sea coast, one of Europe's key gas entry points after the Russian supply shift
environments.GB: Bacton gas terminal on the Norfolk coast, receiving North Sea gas and interconnector flows from the Netherlands and Belgium, windswept East Anglian coastline, the UK's gas entry point connecting to the European TTF market via BBL pipeline

uk_gas.intro: UK gas is priced at the National Balancing Point (NBP), the virtual trading hub for the British gas grid operated by National Gas Transmission. The UK receives gas from the North Sea via subsea pipelines, Norwegian imports through the Langeled pipeline, LNG imports at terminals like Isle of Grain and South Hook, and interconnector pipelines from Belgium and the Netherlands. Priced in pence per therm (GBp/thm).
uk_gas.materials: Same physical material as natural gas. UK-specific infrastructure: grey steel beach terminals where subsea pipelines make landfall, yellow district pipeline markers, British Gas meter boxes on house walls, red-brick boiler houses, copper gas pipes in domestic settings.

origin.subject: North Sea gas platform with processing topsides, subsea pipeline risers visible descending into the grey water, accommodation module with helipad, flare boom at the end of the lattice tower

origin.enhancer: Weathered grey steel structure against grey sea and sky, orange flare on the boom tip providing the only warm colour, white-capped waves, helicopter approaching the helipad, supply vessel at the platform base

coal.intro: Coal is a combustible sedimentary rock formed from compressed ancient vegetation over millions of years. Ranked by carbon content: lignite (brown coal), sub-bituminous, bituminous (the most traded thermal coal), and anthracite. Mined in open-pit (surface) and underground (longwall or room-and-pillar) operations. The Newcastle benchmark (Australia) prices thermal coal for the Asia-Pacific market. Used primarily for electricity generation and steel production (metallurgical coal).
coal.materials: Black lustrous coal with conchoidal fracture surfaces, fine coal dust coating everything, grey overburden rock, massive steel dragline bucket, reinforced rubber conveyor belt, concrete coal bunker walls, steel rail hopper car, ash-grey combustion residue.

origin.subject: Exposed coal seam in an open-cut mine, thick black band clearly visible between layers of grey overburden rock, dragline bucket excavating the seam
origin.lens: 24mm f/11, wide-angle mine panorama, showing the full depth of the pit with coal seam exposed in the pit wall, massive scale conveyed by tiny equipment
origin.enhancer: Jet-black coal seam sharply contrasting grey overburden layers, geological strata visible in the pit wall, coal dust blackening everything nearby, water pooling in the pit floor, massive dragline cable visible

naphtha.intro: Naphtha is a light petroleum distillate — the fraction between gasoline and kerosene in the crude oil distillation column. It is the primary feedstock for petrochemical steam crackers that produce ethylene, propylene, and other building blocks for plastics, synthetic fibres, and chemicals. Also used as a gasoline blending component and industrial solvent. A clear to pale yellow liquid with a characteristic petroleum odour.
naphtha.materials: Clear to pale straw-yellow volatile liquid, stainless steel sample jar, chrome pipe fittings, insulated steam cracker furnace tubes, ceramic-lined cracker coils, white product storage tanks, orange flare from cracker furnace, thick pipe insulation with aluminium cladding.

origin.subject: Naphtha being drawn from the distillation column at a refinery, clear pale-yellow liquid flowing through a sight glass on the side-draw line, multiple product offtake points visible on the column
origin.lens: 50mm f/4, industrial process shot, sharp on the sight glass showing the liquid, distillation column and pipe network providing context behind
origin.enhancer: Pale straw-coloured liquid visible in the sight glass, temperature and pressure gauges flanking the offtake point, insulated column with multiple draw-off nozzles, pipe labels showing product names

environments._default: Refinery atmospheric distillation unit, side-draw piping from the column, product rundown lines to storage, operator checking the sight glass

methanol.intro: Methanol (CH₃OH) is the simplest alcohol — a clear, colourless, water-soluble liquid produced industrially by catalytic synthesis from syngas (carbon monoxide and hydrogen), which is itself derived from natural gas or coal. China is the world's largest producer and consumer, primarily from coal-based feedstock. Used as a chemical feedstock for formaldehyde, acetic acid, and MTBE, as an industrial solvent, and increasingly as a marine and vehicle fuel.
methanol.materials: Clear colourless liquid indistinguishable from water by sight, steel reactor vessels with catalyst beds, chrome pipe fittings and flanges, stainless steel storage tanks, white or silver insulated reactor walls, steam from heat exchangers, copper catalyst pellets.

origin.subject: Coal gasification plant in China, tall gasifier vessels producing syngas, coal handling conveyor feeding the top of the gasifier, ash lock hoppers at the base

origin.enhancer: Dark coal on the feed conveyor against steel gasifier vessels, steam and gas plumes, ash handling below, complex pipe networks connecting the gasifiers, Chinese safety signage and operator in hard hat

bitumen.intro: Bitumen is the heaviest fraction from crude oil distillation — a black, sticky, semi-solid hydrocarbon that softens when heated and hardens when cooled. Produced by vacuum distillation of crude oil residue or extracted from natural deposits (oil sands in Canada, pitch lakes in Trinidad). The primary use is road surfacing (asphalt) — mixed with aggregate to produce hot-mix asphalt (HMA). Also used for waterproofing roofs and as an industrial sealant. China is the world's largest consumer.
bitumen.materials: Black glossy semi-solid with slight tacky sheen, aggregate stones coated in black, hot asphalt steam and heat shimmer, yellow road marking paint, orange construction cones and barriers, steel paving machine rollers, grey uncoated aggregate before mixing, white road edge lines.

origin.subject: Vacuum distillation unit at a refinery producing bitumen from crude oil residue, vacuum column with thick black product flowing from the bottom into a heated storage tank
origin.lens: 35mm f/5.6, industrial process shot, vacuum column as the central element with hot bitumen product piping visible, enough context to show this is the heaviest product in the refinery
origin.enhancer: Thick black bitumen visible through heated sight glass, insulated steam-traced piping preventing solidification, vacuum ejector system at the column top, heat shimmer from the hot product line, dark staining on all surrounding surfaces

environments.CA: Alberta oil sands upgrader, bitumen extraction from mined oil sand, massive tailing ponds visible, boreal forest surrounding, steam rising from upgrader in winter cold

environments._default: Asphalt mixing plant on the outskirts of a town, aggregate stockpiles in various grades, bitumen tank, drum mixer, dust extraction system, dump trucks coming and going
environments.US: American hot-mix plant beside a highway construction project, aggregate quarry adjacent, dump trucks shuttling between the plant and the paving operation a mile away
environments.GB: UK asphalt plant in a quarry setting, green English countryside surrounding, aggregate stockpiles in neat bays, road tanker delivering bitumen, A-road visible from the site

finished.subject: Road paving machine laying fresh hot asphalt on a road surface, black steaming mat of fresh asphalt being spread by the screed, steel-drum roller compacting behind
finished.lens: 35mm f/5.6, construction documentary, paver and roller working in sequence, fresh black asphalt surface contrasting with the grey unfinished road, workers and machinery together
finished.enhancer: Jet-black fresh asphalt steaming in the ambient air, paver screed smoothing the surface, steel-drum roller pressing the hot mat flat, sharp edge between new black surface and old grey road, orange traffic cones and warning signs

environments._default: Road construction site, paving machine laying fresh asphalt, roller compacting behind, traffic management with cones and signs, existing road surface for contrast
environments.US: American highway resurfacing project, wide multi-lane road, massive CAT or Volvo paver, multiple rollers, flaggers in hi-vis, American road infrastructure scale
environments.GB: British A-road resurfacing, single carriageway with traffic management, Wirtgen or Vogele paver, English hedgerows lining the road, rain-washed conditions making the fresh asphalt glisten
environments.CN: Chinese expressway construction, brand-new multi-lane highway being surfaced, enormous scale, multiple pavers working abreast, mountain or plain landscape beyond the construction zone
